rtega_mnemonic:
椎椎RShammer, mallet, beat, vertebra, species of tree
  • shrub like tree 木 where birds 隹 like to sit: chinquapin, material in which a good hammer is made

槌槌RS搥桘椎hammer, mallet, strike, beat
  • pursue 追 the tree 木 with a hammer to strike it
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 隹 indicates the sound; 木 (wood) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
椎牛宰马 [ chuí niú zǎi mǎ ]: to slaughter cows and horses (idiom)
脊椎动物 [ jǐ zhuī dòng wù ]: vertebrate
颈椎 [ jǐng zhuī ]: cervical vertebra; the seven cervical vertebrae in the neck of humans and most mammals
腰椎 [ yāo zhuī ]: lumbar vertebra (lower backbone)
脊椎 [ jǐ zhuī ]: vertebra; backbone
颈椎病 [ jǐng zhuī bìng ]: cervical spondylosis
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 木 [ mù ] tree; wood, lumber; wooden
    • 隹 [ zhuī ] short-tailed bird; sparrow
koohiiStory1: Why is the sweet oak so sweet? Not sure, but to me it tastes just like turkey (with gravy and cranberry sauce!) Now that is sweet.
koohiiStory2: Sweeter than Shiit~ake? Turkeys gobble Shiitake mushrooms椎茸 off the sweet oak tree. 　http://www.flickr.com/photos/tinyhare/13963627/.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The only tree a turkey will live in is an oak tree. They really only do this because oak trees have really yummy acorns and turkeys loooove acorns.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine seeing a turkey sitting in an oak tree munching on acorns. You didn't even know turkeys could fly, but it got up there somehow.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: If you see a bunch of oaks but no turkeys just yell, "SOOEY (つい)!" and they'll all come jumping out! Just because you can't see a turkey in there doesn't mean there isn't one!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine standing in a grove of oak trees and yelling SOOEY! SOOOOOEY! Now watch as hundreds of turkeys come flying at your face! They think you have more acorns for them. RUN!

humanum_full_description_en:
Oracle from the " wood ", " short-tailed bird " sound, the original meaning is beating with sticks, to " hammer ", " Fuels beginning of the text" of.

It was later extended to "beating", such as "Warring States. "Qi Ce Six": "The king's queen quotes the vertebral vertebrae to break the vertebral vertebrae ".

"Said Wen": "Zi, hit also. Qi said that the end is Kwai. From the wood, the sound of 隹." Duan Yucai's note: "Zi, suo, hit also. The two characters suo, today complement. The device is called spine, use It is also called Zhui. The "Dialect" says: "㧙, 抌, Zhuiye. The Southern Chu Fan Xiangzi fights 㧙, or 揔. Pingyong 𣿆 quiet language, or 攩." Guo Yun: "Jiangdong people today Also known as Shii is 攩. "According to the "Dialect" "Zi", this book is often mistakenly pushed from the hand. Qi said that the end of the Kui. "Kao Gong Ji": "Kui is three feet long, the top is the top, and the end is the first." Note Said: "End Kwai, Shii Ye. For the spine is on its stalk, there is nothing to bend." Press, "Kao Gong Ji" "Zhonggu", "Zhou Kui", "椑", all use the same words, Qi Qi Man made. Congmu, Kusheng. "

Inscriptions are used as place names, such as "He Ji" 24389: "Cai (Zai) Shi", and there are also those with incomplete words and unclear semantics, see "He Ji" 13159.

Ancient books are often written as " carving ", such as "Lu Shi Chun Qiu. "Ancient Music": "Zi Zhong", Li Jiahao believes that "Zi Zhong" is a "carved clock", referring to a clock engraved with patterns.

Simplified and silk texts are used as the original meaning, such as "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. Japanese Book A Type" Jane 40 back 2: "Go to the ground five feet, and use the iron spine (section)", which means to leave the ground five feet and hit it (the wall) with a hammer.
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The oracle bone inscriptions start with the sound of " wood " and "隹". The original meaning is a wooden stick used for beating.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從「木」，「隹」聲，本義為敲打用的木棒，為「槌」、「桘」的初文。

　　後引申為「敲打」，如《戰國策．齊策六》：「君王后引椎椎破之」，其中第二個「椎」即為敲打義。

　　《說文》：「椎，擊也。齊謂之終葵。从木，隹聲。」段玉裁注：「椎，所㠯擊也。所㠯二字，今補。器曰椎，用之亦曰椎。《方言》曰：『㧙、抌，椎也。南楚凡相椎搏曰㧙，或曰揔。沅涌𣿆幽之語，或曰攩。』郭云：『今江東人亦名椎爲攩。』按《方言》椎字，今本多誤從手作推。齊謂之終葵。《考工記》：『圭長三尺，杼上，終葵首。』注曰：『終葵，椎也。爲椎於其杼上，明無所屈也。』按，《考工記》「終古」、「終葵」、「椑」，皆用齊言，葢齊人作。從木，隹聲。」

　　卜辭用作地名，如《合集》24389：「才（在）椎」，亦有辭殘而語義不明者，見於《合集》13159。

　　古書通作「彫」，如《呂氏春秋．古樂》：「椎鐘」，李家浩認為「椎鐘」即為「彫鐘」，指的刻有畫紋飾的鐘。

　　簡帛文字用作本義，如《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》簡40背2：「去地五尺，以鐵椎椯（段）之」，意謂離開地面五尺，用鐵鎚敲打它（牆壁）。
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文從「木」，「隹」聲，本義為敲打用的木棒。

甲骨文從「 木 」，「 隹 」聲，本義為敲打用的木棒，為「 槌 」、「 桘 」的初文。 後引申為「敲打」，如《戰國策．齊策六》：「君王后引椎椎破之」，其中第二個「 椎 」即為敲打義。 《說文》：「椎，擊也。齊謂之終葵。从木，隹聲。」段玉裁注：「椎，所㠯擊也。所㠯二字，今補。器曰椎，用之亦曰椎。《方言》曰：『㧙、抌，椎也。南楚凡相椎搏曰㧙，或曰揔。沅涌𣿆幽之語，或曰攩。』郭云：『今江東人亦名椎爲攩。』按《方言》椎字，今本多誤從手作推。齊謂之終葵。《考工記》：『圭長三尺，杼上，終葵首。』注曰：『終葵，椎也。爲椎於其杼上，明無所屈也。』按，《考工記》「終古」、「終葵」、「 椑 」，皆用齊言，葢齊人作。從木，隹聲。」 卜辭用作地名，如《合集》24389：「才（在）椎」，亦有辭殘而語義不明者，見於《合集》13159。 古書通作「 彫 」，如《呂氏春秋．古樂》：「椎鐘」，李家浩認為「椎鐘」即為「彫鐘」，指的刻有畫紋飾的鐘。 簡帛文字用作本義，如《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》簡40背2：「去地五尺，以鐵椎椯（段）之」，意謂離開地面五尺，用鐵鎚敲打它（牆壁）。

椎字的基本解释

椎
zhuī
构成高等动物背部中央骨柱的短骨：椎骨。脊椎。颈椎。胸椎。尾椎。

椎
chuí
敲打东西的器具：铁椎。木椎。鼓椎。
敲打，用椎打击：椎鼓。椎杀。椎心泣血（形容极度悲痛的样子）。
愚钝，朴实：椎鲁。

Vertebra
Basic explanation of words
Vertebra
zhuī
The short bones that make up the central bone column of the back of higher animals: the vertebrae. Spine. Cervical spine. thoracic. Tail vertebrae.
Vertebra
chuí
Apparatus for hitting things: Tiezhu. Mushi. Drum spine.
Beat, beat with vertebral: vertebral drum. Spine kill. Zhuxin crying blood (describe the appearance of extreme grief).
Stupid and simple: Shii Lu.

Source glyph
Vertebra
Name meaning
A mallet, an instrument for percussion.
zhuī, chuí
I zhuī позвонок
颈椎 шейный позвонок
II chuí
1) молот, кувалда
铁椎 железная кувалда
2) вм. 槌 (колотушка, било)
鼓椎 барабанная палочка
3) вм. 捶 (ударять молотком (билом), бить; оглушать; забивать)
椎鼓 бить в барабан
椎牛 забивать быка
4) тупица, чурбан; упрямец; тупой; невосприимчивый
其椎少文如此 таковы его тупость и некультурность
Radicals: 木, 隹  (tree, turkey)
Meaning Mnemonic
The only tree a turkey will live in is an oak tree. They really only do this because oak trees have really yummy acorns and turkeys loooove acorns.
Imagine seeing a turkey sitting in an oak tree munching on acorns. You didn't even know turkeys could fly, but it got up there somehow.
Reading Mnemonic
If you see a bunch of oaks but no turkeys just yell, "SOOEY (つい)!" and they'll all come jumping out! Just because you can't see a turkey in there doesn't mean there isn't one!
Imagine standing in a grove of oak trees and yelling SOOEY! SOOOOOEY! Now watch as hundreds of turkeys come flying at your face! They think you have more acorns for them. RUN!
